Barry,

I have been away dealing with 'family' tragedy. Having returned to =

a 'Nihonto' state of mind, were you able to find that other character 
for=
 the lousy mei of Mune-? Tom gave me a lead that I have studied.

I am cont=
inuing my pursuit of possibly figuring out this signature. 

Thanks for Tom=
's and your effort,

Elliott 

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Barry =
Thomas" <warlord@...> 
wrote:
>
> Tom,
> 
> It's a pretty lousy MUNE-  I ha=
ve another character in mind but 
haven't looked for it yet.  It is well-kn=
own that most signatures on 
kogatana are spurious, and IMHO these are no e=
xception.  Elliot, I am 
sorry but it pains me to say that the characters a=
re crudely 
chiselled with no finesse whatsoever.  A cursory run through my=
 
kogatana book does not reveal any examples signed in such a 
rudimentary =
manner.  I have found a Tadahiro but it is nothing like 
the piece under co=
nsideration.  I doubt there is much to learn from 
these pieces.  It always=
 pays to bear in mind one of Albert 
Yamanaka's immortal sayings "Looking a=
t bad swords ruins your eye".  
It is no less true for kogatana...  But as =
Tom says, thanks for 
posting Elliot.  As a counter to Albert's advice, one=
 of my truisms 
has always been "Look at everything"...
> 
> Regards,
> Bar=
ry Thomas.
